2014-12-31.snippet: A team of curators for the app, whose messages are meant to disappear, will stitch together photos and videos from users at celebrations in cities around the world to create a documentarylike presentation....
2014-12-31.lead_paragraph: A team of curators for the app, whose messages are meant to disappear, will stitch together photos and videos from users at celebrations in cities around the world to create a documentarylike presentation.
2014-12-31.abstract: Mobile messaging service Snapchat will stitch together photos and videos from app's users at New Year's Eve celebrations around world to make documentarylike presentation; after 24 hours, like all of Snapchat's messages, entire story will disappear.

headline.main: Snapchat Plans a Global View of New Year’s Festivities

2014-12-31.snippet: Small businesses are stepping in to help farmers connect with their local markets with marketing, transportation, logistics and other services....
2014-12-31.lead_paragraph: Small businesses are stepping in to help farmers connect with their local markets with marketing, transportation, logistics and other services.
2014-12-31.abstract: Many small businesses, like trucking firm Fresh Connection, are coming to forefront to supply local farmers and their customers with marketing, transportation, logistics and other services; services are meeting growing demand for meat and produce farmed locally; Fresh Connection provides delivery services to farms around New York City.

headline.main: Start-Ups Rise to Close a Gap for Farmers
headline.print_headline: Start-Ups Rise to Close a Gap for Farmers

2014-12-31.snippet: Interviews suggest that Sony — slow to realize the depths of its peril — let its troubles deepen by mounting a public defense only after enormous damage had been done....
2014-12-31.lead_paragraph: Interviews suggest that Sony — slow to realize the depths of its peril — let its troubles deepen by mounting a public defense only after enormous damage had been done.
2014-12-31.abstract: Sony Pictures executives acknowledge that studio was slow to realize depths of security breach and let problems worsen by defending itself publicly only after colossal damage had occurred; company's first decision to treat attack as mostly internal affair reflects Hollywood habit and executive imperturbability of chief executive Michael Lynton.

headline.main: Sony Cyberattack, First a Nuisance, Swiftly Grew Into a Firestorm
headline.print_headline: Sony Attack, First a Nuisance, Swiftly Grew Into a Firestorm

2014-12-31.lead_paragraph: Michael Froman, the United States trade representative, is confident he can persuade Congress to approve a long-pending agreement that encompasses 12 countries.
2014-12-31.abstract: United States trade representative Michael B Froman is sure he can convince Congress to approve complex trade agreement Trans-Pacific Partnership that involves 12 countries; pact would account for 40 percent of world's economic activity and encompasses various strict regulations.

headline.main: Obama’s Trade Chief, Undaunted by Odds, Pushes for Trans-Pacific Partnership
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Trade Chief, Undaunted by Odds, Pushes for a 12-Nation Deal

2014-12-31.snippet: Though oil and gas provide a quarter of Norway’s G.D.P., concern over climate change is fracturing the country’s bond with its flagship company....
2014-12-31.lead_paragraph: Though oil and gas provide a quarter of Norway’s G.D.P., concern over climate change is fracturing the country’s bond with its flagship company.
2014-12-31.abstract: Statoil, Norway's big state-controlled oil company, is coming under pressure for environmental damage created by oil and gas it produces; activism goes further than worries over global warming to company's large presence in Norwegian society; Statoil has long been source of affluence as well as national pride, however.

headline.main: Norwegians Turn Ambivalent on Statoil, Their Economic Bedrock
headline.print_headline: A Nation’s Pride, Chided

2014-12-31.lead_paragraph: The 1920s movie theater, soon to reopen as a performing arts center, is already stimulating development in its neighborhood.
2014-12-31.abstract: Former Loews Kings Theater on Flatbush Avenue in Brooklyn will reopen in February 2015 as $95 million multipurpose performing arts center that is encouraging new development in area; 1920s theater will seat 3,250.

headline.main: Kings Theater in Flatbush Set to Reopen, and Lift a Neighborhood
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn Awaits Return of the Kings

2014-12-31.lead_paragraph: In the new year, the country becomes the 19th nation to adopt the euro, and the likelihood of economic and geopolitical security looms large for many.
2014-12-31.abstract: Lithuania in January 2015 will become 19th country in to adopt euro; analysts and political leaders say it should expedite commerce, end money-changing expenses and help develop new markets to West, but enthusiasm among residents is tepid.

headline.main: As Lithuania Joins Eurozone, Relief and Hesitation
headline.print_headline: In Lithuania, Tepid Greeting for the Euro

2014-12-31.lead_paragraph: Home prices have outpaced wage growth, leaving many potential buyers unable to afford homes and causing both sales and price growth to stall this year.
2014-12-31.abstract: Standard & Poor's/Case-Shiller 20-city home price index rose 4.5 percent in October from year ago October; rate is slowest since October 2012; Conference Board says its consumer confidence index rose to 92.6 in December from revised 91 in November.

headline.main: Case-Shiller Index for October Shows Home Prices Slowing Further
headline.print_headline: Growth in U.S. Home Prices at Slowest Rate Since 2012

2014-12-31.snippet: Spurred by an ignition switch defect in millions of General Motors vehicles, the auto industry has issued more recalls involving old models than ever before, an analysis shows....
2014-12-31.lead_paragraph: Spurred by an ignition switch defect in millions of General Motors vehicles, the auto industry has issued more recalls involving old models than ever before, an analysis shows.
2014-12-31.abstract: Analysis of federal automobile recall records by The New York Times shows auto industry, prodded by decade-old ignition-switch defect in millions of General Motors vehicles, has issued more recalls in 2014 involving old models than ever before; there have been about 700 recalls, totaling more than 60 million vehicles in United States; industry is galvanized and is focusing on neglected safety issues.

headline.main: Auto Industry Galvanized After Record Recall Year
headline.print_headline: Auto Industry Galvanized After Record Recall Year
